org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.common.extensions.mux

Class MuxChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.common.extensions.mux.MuxChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IncomingFrames, OutgoingFrames, SuspendToken, WebSocketConnection, LogicalConnection

    public class MuxChannel
extends Object
implements WebSocketConnection, LogicalConnection, IncomingFrames, SuspendToken
    MuxChannel, acts as WebSocketConnection for specific sub-channel.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: WebSocketConnection
        Send a websocket Close frame, without a status code or reason.

        Basic usage: results in an non-blocking async write, then connection close.

        Specified by:
        close in interface WebSocketConnection
        Specified by:
        close in interface LogicalConnection
        See Also:
        StatusCode, WebSocketConnection.close(int, String)

      • close

        public void close(int statusCode,
         String reason)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocketConnection
        Send a websocket Close frame, with status code.

        Advanced usage: results in an non-blocking async write, then connection close.

        Specified by:
        close in interface WebSocketConnection
        Specified by:
        close in interface LogicalConnection
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the status code
        reason - the (optional) reason. (can be null for no reason)
        See Also:
        StatusCode

        public void setNextIncomingFrames(IncomingFrames incoming)
        Description copied from interface: LogicalConnection
        Set where the connection should send the incoming frames to.

        Often this is from the Parser to the start of the extension stack, and eventually on to the session.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
